titleStmt.title: Letter from J. J. Roberts to Hamilton Fish, September 10, 1869

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from J. J. Roberts to Hamilton Fish
Notes from Liberian Legation In U.S. to Department of State, 1862-1898 T807

div1.p: The undersigned begs leave to inform your Honor that he has been duly authorized and charged by the President of the Republic of Liberia to submit to the consideration of the Government of the United States certain matters relenting particularly to the interests of Liberia, and which, it is believed, will be promotive of the commercial interest of the two countries.

HS
Honorable Hamilton Fish
Secretary of State of the United States
HS therefore, solicits the favor and interview with your Honor for the purpose of stating fully the objects to which he desires to invite your Honor's attention, and in respect to which he is authorized to negotiate

With sentiments of high esteem
I have the honor to be
Your Honor's Most obedient servant
J.J. Roberts
